Type of collection, determines how videos are processed and what data is extracted.

**Collection Types:**
- **entities**: Extract structured data/entities from videos (requires `extract_config`)
- **rich-transcripts**: Generate rich transcriptions with speech and visual descriptions (use `transcribe_config`)

 **Important**: Only provide the config that matches your collection_type. Other configs will be ignored.

The detector strategy to use:

 **adaptive**: Designed for dynamic footage with camera movement, panning, or action. Examples: sports broadcasts, drone footage, handheld documentaries, action movies, live events.
 **content**: Optimized for controlled footage with clear visual transitions. Examples: studio interviews, corporate videos, educational content, product demos, scripted content.

SegmentationConfig.description:
Configuration for video segmentation. **Choose a strategy and provide ONLY the corresponding config:**

 **uniform**: Provide `uniform_config`, do NOT provide `shot_detector_config`
 **shot-detector**: Provide `shot_detector_config`, do NOT provide `uniform_config`

Optionally specify `start_time_seconds` and `end_time_seconds` to limit segmentation to a portion of the video.

strategy.description: Segmentation strategy - determines which config you must provide

uniform_config.description: **REQUIRED when strategy = 'uniform'** - Configuration for uniform segmentation. Do NOT provide when using shot-detector strategy.

shot_detector_config.description: **REQUIRED when strategy = 'shot-detector'** - Configuration for shot detection segmentation. Do NOT provide when using uniform strategy.

start_time_seconds.description: Optional: The start time of the video in seconds to start segmenting from

end_time_seconds.description: Optional: The end time of the video in seconds to stop segmenting at

enable_segment_thumbnails.description: Whether to enable segment thumbnails. If not provided will use default to false. Cannot be used together with segmentation_id.

segmentation_id.description: Segmentation job id to use. If not provided will use default to uniform 20s segmentation. Cannot be provided together with segmentation_config.

segmentation_config.description: Configuration for video segmentation. Cannot be provided together with segmentation_id.

segmentation_id.description: Unique identifier for the segmentation job

status.description: Status of the segmentation job. If a job has the status 'not_applicable' it means that we were unable to find any appropriate scenes for this video. This can be possible if you use the shot-detector strategy.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp of when the segmentation was created

file_id.description: ID of the file this segmentation belongs to

total_segments.description: Total number of segments in this segmentation (only present when status is completed)

data.description: Segment data with pagination (only present when status is completed and segments exist)

start_time.description: Start time of the segment in seconds

end_time.description: End time of the segment in seconds

thumbnail_url.description: URL of the thumbnail for the segment if it exists

limit.description: Number of segments returned in this response

offset.description: Offset from the start of the segments list

total.description: Total number of segmentations matching the query

limit.description: Number of items returned in this response

offset.description: Offset from the start of the list

scope.description: Search scope - 'file' searches at file level (requires collections with enable_summary=true), 'segment' searches at segment level

collections.description: List of collection IDs to search within. Must be rich-transcript collections (collection_type='rich-transcripts'). For file-level search, collections must have 'enable_summary: true' in transcribe_config.

query.description: Text search query to find relevant content

limit.description: Maximum number of search results to return

metadata.description: Filter by file metadata using JSON path expressions

path.description: JSON path for the field to filter on

valueText.description: Text value for scalar comparison (used with NotEqual, Equal, LessThan, GreaterThan)

valueTextArray.description: Array of values for array comparisons (used with ContainsAny, ContainsAll, In)

query.description: The search query that was executed

scope.description: The search scope that was used

results.description: Array of search results ranked by relevance score

limit.description: The limit that was applied to the search

collection_id.description: ID of the collection containing this file

score.description: Relevance score (0-1, higher is more relevant)

collection_id.description: ID of the collection containing this file

score.description: Relevance score (0-1, higher is more relevant)

start_time.description: Start time of the segment in seconds

end_time.description: End time of the segment in seconds

scene_text.description: Text detected on screen in the segment

total.description: Total number of segmentations matching the query

limit.description: Number of items returned in this response

offset.description: Offset from the start of the list

time.description: The time of the thumbnail in seconds relative to the start of the video

segmentation_id.description: The ID of the segmentation if part of a segmentation job

segment_id.description: The ID of the segment if part of a segmentation job
